ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: realising that a back-breaking blow has fallen.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Fearing that a great disaster is going to befall them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: believing that a crushing calamity is about to strike them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: certain of facing a great calamity.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Knowing that they will be subjected to a torment that breaks the backs.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Thinking that some calamity is about to fall on them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Knowing that there will be made to befall them some great calamity.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: thou mightest think the Calamity has been wreaked on them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Thou wilt know that some great disaster is about to fall on them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Imagining that there will befall them a waiste-breaking calomity.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: knowing that they will be dealt out a punishment breaking the spine.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: In the thought that some back-breaking calamity was about to be inflicted on them;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Thinking that some calamity was about to fall on them;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: so they might think the Calamity had been inflicted upon them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Realizing that a back-breaker has befallen them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Expecting that there will be done to them [something] backbreaking.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [75:25] certain that a spine-crushing calamity will fall on them, a great catastrophe, one that ‘crushes the spine’ (fiqār).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Thou wilt know) those faces will know (that some great disaster is about to fall on them) a severe and horrible punishment is about to befall them.
